channel.title: Div align question :) [SOLVED]
channel.description:
Hello, I was wondering if there is a solution to this problem:
there is a wrapper div (800px wide | 100% high) and inside this div there are 3 more divs (header, content, and footer (with there widths set to 100%)). The header and footer divs heights are 100px. I would like the content div's height to dynamically change with the size of the window (aka the size of the wrapper div). I was thinking perhaps some javascript would be in order?
ps. also, I know this is accomplished super easily with tables xD but was wondering if I can be done with divs :)
Thanks tons ~Dave

item.title: Div align question :) [SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @oblivian oblivian
item.description:
@oblivian wrote:

umm, that sort of works but I don’t need 100% height on the content, I need:

100% minus 100px (header) minus 100px (footer)

So perhaps some javascript nonsence but the problem in that is: how would the browser know when to run the resizing script again (or in other words, when the window is resized).

EDIT: so here is some javascript I have (doesnt work tho)

        <script type="text/javascript"> 
	  function resize(){ 
	    var wrapper = document.getElementById("wrapper"); 
	    var content = document.getElementById("content"); 
 	    content.style.height = wrapper.style.height - 200 + "px" 
	  } 
	</script>

I have that set off on the body’s “onload” and “onresize” attributes.

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 03, 2009, 08:23:00 am[/size][hr]solved

heres the code if anyone wants to use it, it sets the content div, 200px less than the height of the browser (unless the content div is higher then the height of the browser)

// JavaScript Document
function resize(){ 
	var content = document.getElementById("content"); 
	var htmlheight = document.body.parentNode.clientHeight;
	var contentheight = htmlheight - 200;
	
 	if (content.offsetHeight <= htmlheight)
	{ content.style.height = contentheight + "px"; }
}

Thanks alot for everyones help
